DNHDD.name: Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX0.name: Mission Oxygen
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX0.description: Mission Oxygen began as an overnight initiative by a community of founders and entrepreneurs across Delhi/NCR to aid and assist hospitals that were running out of oxygen to treat Covid19 patients.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX1.name: Gautam Gambhir Foundation
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX1.description: The Gautam Gambhir Foundation is extending their support to the marginalized, by assuring that their health care workers stand at the first line of defense. These activities involve the distribution of Ration Relief Kits, Cooked Meals, Personal Protective Equipment Kits, N-95 Masks, Nourishment Supplements, Bedding Kits, etc.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX2.name: Mazdoor Kitchen
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX2.description: Mazdoor Kitchen is a citizen run voluntary initiative, working to provide meals and subsistence to daily wage workers in North Delhi. Run by a dedicated team of volunteers comprising professors, students, artists and people from the community itself, it has been providing meals and ration kits to hundreds of people across North Delhi.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX3.name: Breathe India
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX3.description: A group of IIT alumni, in coordination with SaveLife foundation have started a fund collection drive for oxygen .concentrators to be setup in and around Delhi NCR region.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX4.name: Enrich Lives Foundation
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX4.description: Enrich Lives Foundation (formerly Annapurna Movement) is a non-profit organization focused on hunger alleviation, education, women empowerment, poverty alleviation and public health. Enrich Lives Foundation is now involved in a variety of causes affecting the most underprivileged sections of the society such as meal distribution and job placements

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX5.name: Khaana Chahiye
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX5.description: Khaana Chahiye Foundation started as a citizen-led campaign in March 2020 to meet the immediate, lockdown-induced food demands of the homeless, migrant workers, daily wage laborers, and other vulnerable populations in the city of Mumbai

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX6.name: Swasth
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX6.description: Founded in 2009, Swasth Foundation is a non-profit social enterprise committed to health and joy for all. They focus on improving the well-being of the poor by providing a range of affordable and high-quality primary-preventive health services

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX7.name: United Way Mumbai
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX7.description: UWM is a leader in the Indian development sector and works closely with a network of 400+ NGOs and a large number of corporates for their CSR programmes, workplace giving campaigns and other events. This includes designing of CSR policy and strategies, due diligence of NGO partners, programme implementation, employee volunteering, impact assessments and financial and programmatic reporting

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX8.name: Spoorthi Foundation
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX8.description: Sphoorti creates a safe and secure haven for our children to learn, improve, and bloom. This campaign can help provide basic nutrition and vitamin and mineral tablets, dry fruits along with sanitary products like masks, gloves and sanitizers.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX9.name: Hemkunt Foundation
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MSX9.description: Gurugram based NGO working on 12+ projects from last 12 years for upliftment of underprivileged section of society. They are currently distributing Oxygen Cylinders to COVID-19 patients for free.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS10.name: ACT Grants
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS10.description: ACT grant is backing India’s best social entrepreneurs to combat COVID-19 using inventive start-up thinking. they are using their resources to find solutions to the acute shortage of oxygen by setting up oxygen concentrators at hospitals and nursing homes.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS11.name: Feeding From Far
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS11.description: Feeding From Far is an initiative that has been feeding the poor and unemployed who are struggling to feed themselves during the lockdown. They have managed to distributed over 10 lakh meals to the needy since the first lockdown hit through cooked meals and ration kits.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS12.name: Khalsa Aid
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS12.description: Khalsa Aid international is providing free oxygen concentrators to COVID patients

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS13.name: MCKS Food
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS13.description: MCKS Food for the Hungry Foundation Delhi, is a not for profit organization started in 2005. They affect the lives of people in a tangible way; reaching out with food to the hungry and empowering them with skills to move from despair to hope.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS14.name: Making the Difference
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS14.description: MTD is providing medical equipments all over Mumbai, masks and kits PPE in Varanasi, tiffin service to home quarantine patient in Mira bhayander, ration distribution for local communities all over Mumbai

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS15.name: Give India
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS15.description: Established in 2000, Give India is one of the most trusted crowdfunding websites in India. They have launched ICRF-2 to support gaps in healthcare and other critical needs.

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS16.name: Help Now Ambulance Services
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS16.description: HelpNow is an Initiative by young students providing a safe, 24x7 logistics network for transporting COVID patients/suspects, Drugs, Phlebotomists, Healthcare workers (doctors, nurses) and Blood/Organs/Medical supplies in India

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS17.name: Concern India
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS17.description: Concern India Foundation was set up in 1991 as a registered non-profit, public charitable trust to extend financial and non-financial support to grassroots level NGOs working in the areas of education, health and community development

-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS18.name: KVN Foundation
-Ma7omfOm1LECg57MS18.description: KVN Foundation is supplying free oxygen concentrators to the needy so that they can get critical life support till they find a hospital bed, get access to doctors, or recover completely. These will be provided for 5 to 10 days’ duration as needed, will then be taken back, sanitized, reused on next patient with fresh set of consumables
